org.garret.perst
Interface CustomAllocator

All Superinterfaces:
java.io.Externalizable, ILoadable, IPersistent, IStoreable, java.io.Serializable
public interface CustomAllocator
extends IPersistent

Custom allocator interface. Custom allocator can be used for more efficiently allocate space using application specific semantic of the object. For example, application can place all BLOBs (images, texts, video,...) in separate file, located at separate disk and keep file with the rest of the data (metadata describing this BLOBs) relatively small, improving speed of search operations. Such separation of BLOBs and their descriptors can be achieved using custom allocator in conjunction with multifile. First segment is used for allocation of normal (non-BLOB) objects. It's size can be set practically unlimited: 0x1000 0000 0000 0000. And second segment should be used by custom allocator to allocate BLOBs. So BLOBs offsets are started from 0x1000000000000000 and BLOB content will be stored in separate file which in turn can be located at separate disk.

Method Detail

allocate

long allocate(long size)
Allocate object

Parameters:
size - allocated object size
Returns:
position of the object in daatbase file, It should not overlap with space covered by main database allocation bitmap

commit

void commit()
Make it possible to reuse space of all previously deallocated shadow objects.

free

void free(long pos,
          long size)
Deallocate object previously allocated by this allocator. Space used by this object can not be reused until transaction commit (when commit method is called for this allocator)

Parameters:
pos - position of the object
size - size of allocated object

getSegmentBase

long getSegmentBase()
Get allocator segment basse address

getSegmentSize

long getSegmentSize()
Get allocator segment size

reallocate

long reallocate(long pos,
                long oldSize,
                long newSize)
Reallocate object previously allocated by this allocator. This method should try to extend or shrink this object in its current location and if it is not possible, allocate new space for the object and free its old location.

Parameters:
pos - old position of the object
oldSize - old size of the object
newSize - new size of the object
Returns:
new position of the object (it can be equal to old position)
